definitions.definition: A bright, directional light or lamp, especially one used to illuminate the focus or center of attention on a stage.
The circle of light shed by a spotlight.
The center of attention; the highlight or most important part.
definitions.example: Some people enjoy the spotlight.

definitions.definition: To illuminate with a spotlight.
definitions.example: We spotlight the star, but the supporting cast has all the great lines in this scene.

definitions.definition: To draw attention to.
definitions.example: The news series served to spotlight corruption.

definitions.definition: The series of bones situated at the back from the head to the pelvis of a person, or from the head to the tail of an animal; backbone, vertebral column.
Something resembling a backbone, such as a ridge, or a long, central structure from which other structures radiate.
A pointed, fairly rigid protuberance or needle-like structure on an animal, shell, or plant.
The heartwood of trees.
Courage or assertiveness.
The stiffness of an arrow.
The state of being conscious or aware; awareness.
The vapor formed when water changes from liquid phase to gas phase.
Pressurized water vapour used for heating, cooking, or to provide mechanical energy.
Internal energy for motive power.
definitions.example: After three weeks in bed he was finally able to sit up under his own steam.

definitions.definition: Pent-up anger.
definitions.example: Dad had to go outside to blow off some steam.

definitions.definition: A steam-powered vehicle.
Travel by means of a steam-powered vehicle.
Any exhalation.
Fencing without the use of any electric equipment.
To cook with steam.
definitions.example: The best way to cook artichokes is to steam them.

definitions.definition: To expose to the action of steam; to apply steam to for softening, dressing, or preparing.
definitions.example: to steam wood or cloth

definitions.definition: To produce or vent steam.
To rise in vapour; to issue, or pass off, as vapour.
definitions.example: Our breath steamed in the cold winter air.

definitions.definition: To become angry; to fume; to be incensed.
To make angry.
definitions.example: It really steams me to see her treat him like that.

definitions.definition: To be covered with condensed water vapor.
definitions.example: With all the heavy breathing going on the windows were quickly steamed in the car.

definitions.definition: To travel by means of steam power.
definitions.example: The ship steamed out of the harbour

definitions.definition: To move with great or excessive purposefulness.
definitions.example: If he heard of anyone picking the fruit he would steam off and lecture them.

definitions.definition: To exhale.
Old-fashioned; from before the digital age.
To take upon oneself; to start, to embark on (a specific task etc.).
To commit oneself (to an obligation, activity etc.).
definitions.example: He undertook to exercise more in future.

definitions.definition: To overtake on the wrong side.
definitions.example: I hate people who try and undertake on the motorway.

definitions.definition: To pledge; to assert, assure; to dare say.
To take by trickery; to trap, to seize upon.
To assume, as a character; to take on.
To engage with; to attack, take on in a fight.
To have knowledge of; to hear.
To have or take charge of.
Something that is compulsory or required.
Required; obligatory; mandatory.
definitions.example: The ten-dollar fee was compulsory.

definitions.definition: Having the power of compulsion; constraining.
definitions.example: Such compulsory measures are limited.

definitions.definition: A heavy, loosely woven fabric, usually large and woollen, used for warmth while sleeping or resting.
definitions.example: The baby was cold, so his mother put a blanket over him.

definitions.definition: A layer of anything.
definitions.example: The city woke under a thick blanket of fog.

definitions.definition: A thick rubber mat used in the offset printing process to transfer ink from the plate to the paper being printed.
definitions.example: A press operator must carefully wash the blanket whenever changing a plate.

definitions.definition: A streak or layer of blubber in whales.
To cover with, or as if with, a blanket.
definitions.example: A fresh layer of snow blanketed the area.

definitions.definition: To traverse or complete thoroughly.
definitions.example: The salesman blanketed the entire neighborhood.

definitions.definition: To toss in a blanket by way of punishment.
To take the wind out of the sails of (another vessel) by sailing to windward of it.
To nullify the impact of someone or something.
General; covering or encompassing everything.
definitions.example: They sought to create a blanket solution for all situations.

definitions.definition: That branch of government which is responsible for making, or having the power to make, a law or laws.
Making, or having the power to make, a law or laws; lawmaking
definitions.example: Although enormously influential in shaping the laws of the land, The House of Lords are not actually a legislative body.

definitions.definition: An organic compound.
An organic food.
A living organism, as opposed to a robot or hologram.
Pertaining to or derived from living organisms.
Pertaining to an organ of the body of a living organism.
Relating to the compounds of carbon, relating to natural products.
Of food or food products, grown in an environment free from artificial agrichemicals, and possibly certified by a regulatory body.

Describing a form of social solidarity theorized by Emile Durkheim that is characterized by voluntary engagements in complex interdependencies for mutual benefit (such as business agreements), rather than mechanical solidarity, which depends on ascribed relations between people (as in a family or tribe).
Of a military unit or formation, or its elements, belonging to a permanent organization (in contrast to being temporarily attached).
Instrumental; acting as instruments of nature or of art to a certain destined function or end.
(of search results) Generated according to the ranking algorithms of a search engine, as opposed to paid placement by advertisers.
Developing in a gradual or natural fashion.
definitions.example: The writing of the script was an organic process.

definitions.definition: Harmonious; coherent; structured.
definitions.example: The production came together in an organic whole.

definitions.definition: Clothing and ornamentation.
A collection laid out to be viewed in full.
An orderly series, arrangement or sequence.
Order; a regular and imposing arrangement; disposition in regular lines; hence, order of battle.
definitions.example: drawn up in battle array

definitions.definition: A large collection.
definitions.example: We offer a dazzling array of choices.

definitions.definition: Common name for matrix.

Any of various data structures designed to hold multiple elements of the same type; especially, a data structure that holds these elements in adjacent memory locations so that they may be retrieved using numeric indices.
A ranking or setting forth in order, by the proper officer, of a jury as impanelled in a cause; the panel itself; or the whole body of jurors summoned to attend the court.
A militia.
A group of hedgehogs.
A microarray.
To clothe and ornament; to adorn or attire.
definitions.example: He was arrayed in his finest robes and jewels.

definitions.definition: To lay out in an orderly arrangement; to deploy or marshal.
To set in order, as a jury, for the trial of a cause; that is, to call them one at a time.
To drive together, round up
To overpower; to subdue.
To force, constrain or coerce.
definitions.example: Logic compels the wise, while fools feel compelled by emotions.

definitions.definition: To exact, extort, (make) produce by force.
To force to yield; to overpower; to subjugate.
To gather or unite in a crowd or company.
To call forth; to summon.
An act of compulsion; an obliging somebody to do something.
Strongly or irresistibly evoking interest or attention.
definitions.example: There are compelling reasons why a manager should have previous experience.

definitions.definition: Forceful.
definitions.example: The politician had compelling ambition.

definitions.definition: A person confined to an institution such as a prison (as a convict) or hospital (as a patient).
A person who shares a residence, such as a lodger, a hotel guest, or a student living on campus.
The study of resource allocation, distribution and consumption; of capital and investment; and of management of the factors of production.
A public gathering or mass meeting that is not mainly a protest and is organized to inspire enthusiasm for a cause.
definitions.example: a campaign rally

definitions.definition: A protest or demonstration for or against something, but often with speeches and often without marching, especially in North America.
definitions.example: a political rally

definitions.definition: A sequence of strokes between serving and scoring a point.
An event in which competitors drive through a series of timed special stages at intervals. The winner is the driver who completes all stages with the shortest cumulative time.
A recovery after a decline in prices (said of the market, stocks, etc.)
To collect, and reduce to order, as troops dispersed or thrown into confusion; to gather again; to reunite.
To come into orderly arrangement; to renew order, or united effort, as troops scattered or put to flight; to assemble; to unite.
To collect one's vital powers or forces; to regain health or consciousness; to recuperate.
To recover strength after a decline in prices; -- said of the market, stocks, etc.
Good-humoured raillery.
To tease; to chaff good-humouredly.
Pertaining to or based on experience.
Pertaining to, derived from, or testable by observations made using the physical senses or using instruments which extend the senses.
(philosophy of science) Verifiable by means of scientific experimentation.
The act or quality of endorsing
definitions.example: Companies sometimes pay millions for product endorsement by celebrities.

definitions.definition: An amendment or annotation to an insurance contract or other official document (such as a driving licence).
definitions.example: Mr. Jones paid extra for the flood damage endorsement on his house insurance.

definitions.definition: An instructor's signed acknowledgement of time practising specific flying skills.
definitions.example: Once she obtained the endorsement of her night flying hours, Joanna was approved to take the pilot's examination.

definitions.definition: (certification) Permission to carry out a specific skill or application in a field in which the practitioner already has a general licence.
definitions.example: To transport gasoline, truckers must have a valid licence and the hazardous materials endorsement.

definitions.definition: Sponsorship, in means of money, by a company, business or enterprise.
definitions.example: After the Olympics, he was hoping to get an endorsement deal.

definitions.definition: Support from an important, renowned figure of a media (celebrity, politics, sports, etc.), to get back up.
definitions.example: I'm not sure whether an endorsement from Donald Trump will help or hurt.

definitions.definition: The shore or beach of the sea or ocean; shore; beach.
definitions.example: Grand Strand

definitions.definition: The shore or beach of a lake or river.
A small brook or rivulet.
A passage for water; gutter.
A street (perhaps from the similarity of shape).
To run aground; to beach.
To leave (someone) in a difficult situation; to abandon or desert.
To cause the third out of an inning to be made, leaving a runner on base.
definitions.example: Jones pops up; that's going to strand a pair.

definitions.definition: Each of the strings which, twisted together, make up a yarn, rope or cord.
A string.
An individual length of any fine, string-like substance.
definitions.example: strand of hair.

definitions.definition: A group of wires, usually twisted or braided.
A series of programmes on a particular theme or linked subject.
An element in a composite whole; a sequence of linked events or facts; a logical thread.
definitions.example: strand of truth

definitions.definition: A nucleotide chain.
To break a strand of (a rope).
To form by uniting strands.
A walk that is taken regularly for good health and wellbeing.
Relating to a legal or political constitution.
definitions.example: Brexit has rocked the foundations and plunged everyone into a state of heightened constitutional anxiety.

definitions.definition: In compliance with or valid under a legal or political constitution.
definitions.example: The Court of Appeal ruled against the accused and found the law constitutional.

definitions.definition: Belonging to, or inherent in, the constitution, or in the structure of body or mind.
definitions.example: a constitutional infirmity

definitions.definition: For the benefit of one's constitution or health.
definitions.example: a constitutional walk

definitions.definition: A rapidly executed freehand drawing that is not intended as a finished work, often consisting of a multitude of overlapping lines.
A rough design, plan, or draft, as a rough draft of a book.
A brief description of a person or account of an incident; a general presentation or outline.
A brief, light, or unfinished dramatic, musical, or literary work or idea; especially a short, often humorous or satirical scene or play, frequently as part of a revue or variety show, a skit
An amusing person.
A lookout; vigilant watch for something.
definitions.example: to keep sketch

definitions.definition: A humorous newspaper article summarizing political events, making heavy use of metaphor, paraphrase and caricature.

A formal specification of a mathematical structure or a data type described in terms of a graph and diagrams (and cones (and cocones)) on it. It can be implemented by means of “models”, which are functors which are graph homomorphisms from the formal specification to categories such that the diagrams become commutative, the cones become limiting (i.e., products), the cocones become colimiting (i.e., sums).
To make a brief, basic drawing.
definitions.example: I usually sketch with a pen rather than a pencil.

definitions.definition: To describe briefly and with very few details.
definitions.example: He sketched the accident, sticking to the facts as they had happened.

definitions.definition: Sketchy, shady, questionable.
Someone who or something that trails.
Part of an object which extends some distance beyond the main body of the object.
definitions.example: the trailer of a plant

definitions.definition: An unpowered wheeled vehicle, not a caravan or camper, that is towed behind another, and used to carry equipment, etc, that cannot be carried in the leading vehicle.
definitions.example: At the end of the day, we put the snowmobiles back on the trailer.

definitions.definition: A furnished vehicle towed behind another, and used as a dwelling when stationary; a caravan; a camper.
definitions.example: We drove our trailer to Yellowstone Park.

definitions.definition: A prefabricated home that could be towed to a new destination but is typically permanently left in an area designated for such homes.
definitions.example: The young couple′s first home was in a trailer.

definitions.definition: A preview of a film, video game or TV show.
definitions.example: The trailer for that movie makes it seem like it would be fun.

definitions.definition: A short blank segment of film at the end of a reel, for convenient insertion of the film in a projector.

The final record of a list of data items, often identified by a key field with an otherwise invalid value that sorts last alphabetically (e.g., “ZZZZZ”) or numerically (“99999”); especially common in the context of punched cards, where the final card is called a trailer card.
definitions.example: The linked list terminates with a trailer record.

definitions.definition: The last part of a packet, often containing a check sequence.
definitions.example: The encapsulation layer adds an eight-byte header and a two-byte trailer to each packet.

definitions.definition: To load on a trailer or to transport by trailer.
definitions.example: The engine wouldn't run any more so we had to trailer my old car to the wrecking yard.

definitions.definition: To cast a vote; to assert a formalized choice in an election
definitions.example: Did you vote last month?

definitions.definition: To choose or grant by means of a vote, or by general consent
definitions.example: The depository may vote shares on behalf of investors who have not submitted instruction to the bank.

definitions.definition: Action of the verb to vote
definitions.example: Voting, in and of itself, is not evil. But when there are only evils to choose from, we need to seek another choice. ― Justin Deschamps

definitions.definition: Having an associated right for the holder to vote as an owner of business.
definitions.example: The cumulative voting preferred stock remains voting until all cumulative dividends are paid.

definitions.definition: (Also in plural: spoils) Plunder taken from an enemy or victim.
Material (such as rock or earth) removed in the course of an excavation, or in mining or dredging. Tailings.
To strip (someone who has been killed or defeated) of their arms or armour.
To strip or deprive (someone) of their possessions; to rob, despoil.
To plunder, pillage (a city, country etc.).
To carry off (goods) by force; to steal.
To ruin; to damage (something) in some way making it unfit for use.
To ruin the character of, by overindulgence; to coddle or pamper to excess.
Of food, to become bad, sour or rancid; to decay.
definitions.example: Make sure you put the milk back in the fridge, otherwise it will spoil.

definitions.definition: To render (a ballot paper) invalid by deliberately defacing it.
To reveal the ending or major events of (a story etc.); to ruin (a surprise) by exposing it ahead of time.
A fellow, comrade, colleague, partner or someone with whom something is shared, e.g. shipmate, classmate.
(especially of a non-human animal) A breeding partner.
A friend, usually of the same sex.
definitions.example: He's my best mate.

definitions.definition: Friendly term of address to a stranger, usually male, of similar age
definitions.example: Excuse me, mate, have you got the time?

definitions.definition: In naval ranks, a non-commissioned officer or his subordinate (e.g. Boatswain's Mate, Gunner's Mate, Sailmaker's Mate, etc).
A ship's officer, subordinate to the master on a commercial ship.
A first mate.
A technical assistant in certain trades (e.g. gasfitter's mate, plumber's mate); sometimes an apprentice.
The other member of a matched pair of objects.
definitions.example: I found one of the socks I wanted to wear, but I couldn't find its mate.

definitions.definition: A suitable companion; a match; an equal.
To match, fit together without space between.
definitions.example: The pieces of the puzzle mate perfectly.

definitions.definition: To copulate.
To pair in order to raise offspring
To arrange in matched pairs.
To introduce (animals) together for the purpose of breeding.
(of an animal) To copulate with.
To marry; to match (a person).
To match oneself against; to oppose as equal; to compete with.
To fit (objects) together without space between.
To move (a space shuttle orbiter) onto the back of an aircraft that can carry it.
The conclusive victory in a game of chess that occurs when an opponent's king is threatened with unavoidable capture.
(by extension) Any losing situation with no escape; utter defeat.
To put the king of an opponent into checkmate.
definitions.example: That jerk checkmated me in four moves!

definitions.definition: (by extension) To place in a losing situation that has no escape.
To confuse; to confound.
The abovementioned plant; the leaves and shoots used for the tea
An evergreen tree, Ilex paraquariensis, native to South America, cultivated for its leaves.
A beverage, resembling tea, made from the dried leaves of this plant.
A cup of this drink.
To encourage development or induce increased activity; to stimulate.
To put a device, mechanism (alarm etc.) or system into action or motion; to trigger, to actuate, to set off, to enable.
To render more reactive; excite.
To render a molecule reactive, active, or effective in performing its function.
To render a substance radioactive.
To hasten a chemical reaction, especially by heating.
To remove the limitations of demoware by providing a license; to unlock.
To aerate in order to aid decomposition of organic matter.
To organize or create a military unit or station.
To bring a player back after an injury.
The act, manner or style of executing (actions, maneuvers, performances).
The state of being accomplished.
definitions.example: The mission's successful execution lifted the troops' morale.

definitions.definition: The act of putting to death or being put to death as a penalty, or actions so associated.
The carrying into effect of a court judgment, or of a will.
The formal process by which a contract is made valid and put into binding effect.
The carrying out of an instruction, program or program segment by a computer.
definitions.example: The entire machine slowed down during the execution of the virus checker.

definitions.definition: The process of achieving agreement through discussion.
(chiefly in plural or attributive) A homosexual, especially a male homosexual; see also lesbian.
Something which is bright or colorful, such as a picture or a flower.
An ornament, a knick-knack.
To make happy or cheerful.
To cause (something, e.g. AIDS) to be associated with homosexual people.
(possibly obsolete) Happy, joyful, and lively.
definitions.example: The Gay Science

definitions.definition: Quick, fast.
(possibly obsolete) Festive, bright, or colourful.
definitions.example: Pennsylvania Dutch include the plain folk and the gay folk.

definitions.definition: Sexually promiscuous (of any gender), (sometimes particularly) engaged in prostitution.
Homosexual:
A pejorative:
(of a dog's tail) Upright or curved over the back.
(possibly obsolete) Considerable, great, large in number, size, or degree.
(possibly obsolete) Considerably, very.
The letter —, which stands for the sound /ɡ/, in Pitman shorthand.
Actions performed to keep some machine or system functioning or in service.
A tort committed when a third party who does not have a bona fide interest in a lawsuit provides help or acquires an interest to a litigant's lawsuit.
Alimony, a periodical payment or a lump sum made or ordered to be made to a spouse after a divorce.
Child support.
Money required or spent to provide for the needs of a person or a family.
The natural process which keeps an organism alive.
An inland body of standing water, either natural or man-made, that is smaller than a lake.
An inland body of standing water of any size that is fed by springs rather than by a river.
The Atlantic Ocean. Especially in across the pond.
definitions.example: I haven't been back home across the pond in twenty years.

definitions.definition: To block the flow of water so that it can escape only through evaporation or seepage; to dam.
To make into a pond; to collect, as water, in a pond by damming.
To form a pond; to pool.
To ponder.
Able to be sustained.
Able to be produced or sustained for an indefinite period without damaging the environment, or without depleting a resource; renewable.
To put together.
definitions.example: He assembled the model ship.

definitions.definition: To gather as a group.
definitions.example: The parents assembled in the school hall.

definitions.definition: To translate from assembly language to machine code
A person who or thing that receives or is intended to receive something. More formal, usually referring to one who receives such things as an award or medal.
A car with automatic transmission.
definitions.example: I never learned to drive a stick. I can only drive an automatic.

definitions.definition: A semi-automatic pistol.
definitions.example: The G-men raiding the speakeasy were equipped with .45 automatics, while the local policemen were carrying revolvers and shotguns.

definitions.definition: Capable of operating without external control or intervention.
definitions.example: The automatic clothes washer was a great labor-saving device.

definitions.definition: Done out of habit or without conscious thought.
definitions.example: Absent-minded doodling is a form of automatic art.

definitions.definition: Necessary, inevitable, prescribed by logic, law, etc.
definitions.example: Spitting at another player means an automatic red card.

definitions.definition: (of a firearm such as a machine gun) Firing continuously as long as the trigger is pressed until ammunition is exhausted.
definitions.example: Fully automatic weapons cannot be legally owned by private citizens in the US, except in very special circumstances, as by private security companies.

definitions.definition: (of a handgun) An autoloader; a semi-automatic or self-loading pistol, as opposed to a revolver or other manually actuated handgun, which fires one shot per pull of the trigger; distinct from machine guns.
definitions.example: The US Army adopted John Browning's M1911 pistol as its sidearm, chambered in .45 ACP (Automatic Colt Pistol).

definitions.definition: (of a local variable) Automatically added to and removed from the stack during the course of function calls.
(of a group) Having one or more finite-state automata
A heavy load.
A responsibility, onus.
A cause of worry; that which is grievous, wearisome, or oppressive.
The capacity of a vessel, or the weight of cargo that she will carry.
definitions.example: a ship of a hundred tons burden

definitions.definition: The tops or heads of stream-work which lie over the stream of tin.
The proportion of ore and flux to fuel, in the charge of a blast furnace.
A fixed quantity of certain commodities.
definitions.example: A burden of gad steel is 120 pounds.

definitions.definition: A birth.
The total amount of toxins, parasites, cancer cells, plaque or similar present in an organism.
To encumber with a literal or figurative burden.
definitions.example: to burden a nation with taxes

definitions.definition: To impose, as a load or burden; to lay or place as a burden (something heavy or objectionable).
A phrase or theme that recurs at the end of each verse in a folk song or ballad.
The drone of a bagpipe.
Theme, core idea.
definitions.example: the burden of the argument

definitions.definition: A member of a commission.
Someone commissioned to perform certain duties.
An official in charge of a government department, especially a police force.
Someone who commissions something.
An allocated amount.
That which is divided off or separated, as a part from a whole; a separated part of anything.
One's fate; lot.
The part of an estate given or falling to a child or heir; an inheritance.
A wife's fortune; a dowry.
To divide into amounts, as for allocation to specific purposes.
To endow with a portion or inheritance.

Government department, at the administrative level normally headed by a minister (or equivalent rank, e.g. secretary of state), who holds it as portfolio, especially in a constitutional monarchy, but also as a polity
definitions.example: She works for the ministry of finance.

definitions.definition: The complete body of government ministers (whether or not they are in cabinet) under the leadership of a head of government (such as a prime minister)
definitions.example: The premier offered his last ministry's resignation to the monarch, and is asked to form a new one in accordance with the election results.

definitions.definition: A ministration
The active practice and education of the minister of a particular religion or faith.
The clergy of nonapostolic Protestant churches.
Work of a spiritual or charitable nature.
definitions.example: the present ministry of the Holy Spirit

definitions.definition: The act or an instance of violating or the condition of being violated.
A lawyer; one who advises or represents others in legal matters as a profession.
(UK 19th century and earlier) One such who practised in the courts of the common law (cf solicitor, proctor).
(20th century and later, rare, usually pejorative) A solicitor.
(obsolete outside set phrases) An agent or representative authorized to act on someone else's behalf.
A title given to lawyers and notaries public, or those holders by profession who also do other jobs. Usually capitalized or abbreviated as Atty.
To work as a legal attorney.
To provide with a legal attorney.
A temporary group or union of organizations, usually formed for a particular advantage.
definitions.example: The Liberal Democrats and Conservative parties formed a coalition government in 2010.

definitions.definition: The collective noun for a group of cheetahs.
A devotional exercise of, or leading to contemplation.
A contemplative discourse, often on a religious or philosophical subject.
A musical theme treated in a meditative manner.
For, during, or involving less than the normal time for some activity, especially the number of hours an employee works.
A judicial examination.
An examination in general.

An independent review and examination of records and activities to assess the adequacy of system controls, to ensure compliance with established policies and operational procedures, and to recommend necessary changes in controls, policies, or procedures
definitions.example: National Assembly audit

definitions.definition: The result of such an examination, or an account as adjusted by auditors; final account.
Spiritual counseling, which forms the core of Dianetics.
A general receptacle or receiver.
An audience; a hearing.
To examine and adjust (e.g. an account).
definitions.example: to audit the accounts of a treasure, or of parties who have a suit depending in court

definitions.definition: To conduct an independent review and examination of system records and activities in order to test the adequacy and effectiveness of data security and data integrity procedures, to ensure compliance with established policy and operational procedures, and to recommend any necessary changes
To counsel spiritually.
To attend an academic class on a not-for-academic-credit basis.
A state where sovereignty rests with the people or their representatives, rather than with a monarch or emperor; a country with no monarchy.
definitions.example: The United States is a republic; the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland is a constitutional monarchy.

definitions.definition: A state, which may or may not be a monarchy, in which the executive and legislative branches of government are separate.
One of the subdivisions constituting Russia. See oblast.
definitions.example: The Republic of Udmurtia is west of the Permian Oblast.

definitions.definition: To die; in later use especially to die slowly, waste away.
To die because of lack of food or of not eating.
To be very hungry.
definitions.example: Hey, ma, I'm starving! What's for dinner?

definitions.definition: To destroy, make capitulate or at least make suffer by deprivation, notably of food.
To deprive of nourishment or of some vital component.
definitions.example: The patient's brain was starved of oxygen.

definitions.definition: To deteriorate for want of any essential thing.
(especially Yorkshire and Lancashire) To kill with cold.
definitions.example: I was half starved waiting out in that wind.

definitions.definition: An excavation in the earth as a place of burial
Any place of interment; a tomb; a sepulcher.
(by extension) Death, destruction.
To dig.
To carve or cut, as letters or figures, on some hard substance; to engrave.
To carve out or give shape to, by cutting with a chisel; to sculpture.
definitions.example: to grave an image

definitions.definition: To impress deeply (on the mind); to fix indelibly.
To entomb; to bury.
To write or delineate on hard substances, by means of incised lines; to practice engraving.
A written accent used in French, Italian, and other languages. è is an e with a grave accent (`).
Characterised by a dignified sense of seriousness; not cheerful.
Low in pitch, tone etc.
Serious, in a negative sense; important, formidable.
Influential, important; authoritative.
A count, prefect, or person holding office.
To clean, as a vessel's bottom, of barnacles, grass, etc., and pay it over with pitch — so called because graves or greaves was formerly used for this purpose.
A person who acts as the voice of a group of people.
As a matter of supposition; in the beliefs or according to the claims of some people.
definitions.example: According to your testimony, you were supposedly at home watching TV when the murder occurred.

definitions.definition: A large group of musicians who play together on various instruments, usually including some from strings, woodwind, brass and/or percussion; the instruments played by such a group.
A semicircular space in front of the stage used by the chorus in Ancient Greek and Hellenistic theatres.
The area in a theatre or concert hall where the musicians sit, immediately in front of and below the stage, sometimes (also) used by other performers.
A realm having a king and/or queen as its actual or nominal sovereign.
A realm, region, or conceptual space where something is dominant.
definitions.example: the kingdom of the dead

definitions.definition: A rank in the classification of organisms, below domain and above phylum; a taxon at that rank (e.g. the plant kingdom, the animal kingdom).
A loud sound, like the crashing together of metal objects.
definitions.example: I heard a clash from the kitchen, and rushed in to find the cat had knocked over some pots and pans.

definitions.definition: A skirmish, a hostile encounter.
A match; a game between two sides.
An angry argument
Opposition; contradiction; such as between differing or contending interests, views, purposes etc.
definitions.example: a clash of beliefs

definitions.definition: A combination of garments that do not look good together, especially because of conflicting colours.
definitions.example: She was wearing a horrible clash of red and orange.

definitions.definition: An instance of restarting the game after a "dead ball", where it is dropped between two opposing players, who can fight for possession.
Chatter; gossip; idle talk.
To make a clashing sound.
definitions.example: The cymbals clashed.

definitions.definition: To cause to make a clashing sound.
To come into violent conflict.
definitions.example: Fans from opposing teams clashed on the streets after the game.

definitions.definition: To argue angrily.
(in games or sports) To face each other in an important game.
(of clothes, decor, colours) To fail to look good together; to contrast unattractively; to fail to harmonize.
definitions.example: The hotel room was ugly, and the wallpaper clashed with the carpet.

definitions.definition: (of events) To coincide, to happen at the same time, thereby rendering it impossible to attend all.
definitions.example: I can't come to your wedding because it clashes with a friend's funeral.

definitions.definition: To chatter or gossip.

A device using gunpowder and other chemicals which, when lit, emits a combination of coloured flames, sparks, whistles or bangs, and sometimes made to rocket high into the sky before exploding, used for entertainment or celebration.
definitions.example: Commercial firework displays are commonly launched from boats or other vessels

definitions.definition: One who holds an intermediate position between extremes, as in politics.
definitions.example: The moderates are the natural advocates of ecumenism against the fanatics of their churches.

definitions.definition: One of a party in Scottish Church history dominant in the 18th century, lax in doctrine and discipline, but intolerant of evangelicalism and popular rights. It caused the secessions of 1733 and 1761, and its final resultant was the Disruption of 1843.
To reduce the excessiveness of (something)
definitions.example: to moderate rage, action, desires, etc.

definitions.definition: To become less excessive
To preside over (something) as a moderator
definitions.example: to moderate a synod

definitions.definition: To act as a moderator; to assist in bringing to compromise
Not excessive; acting in moderation
definitions.example: a moderate Calvinist

definitions.definition: Mediocre
Average priced; standard-deal
Not violent or rigorous; temperate; mild; gentle.
definitions.example: a moderate winter

definitions.definition: Having an intermediate position between liberal and conservative.
Cause, interest or account
definitions.example: For the sake of argument

definitions.definition: Purpose or end; reason
definitions.example: For old times' sake

definitions.definition: The benefit or regard of someone or something
(obsolete except in phrases) contention, strife; guilt, sin, accusation or charge
An alcoholic beverage made from fermenting various forms of rice, usually with an ABV similar to wine.
A class of Japanese rice wines made from polished rice and typically about 20% alcohol by volume.
Not to have the same traits or characteristics; to be unalike or distinct.
definitions.example: These shoes only differ from those ones in having slightly longer laces.

definitions.definition: (people, groups, etc.) To have diverging opinions, disagree.
To be separated in quantity.
definitions.example: The numbers 3 and 21 differ by 18.

definitions.definition: To work or act together, especially for a common purpose or benefit.
To allow for mutual unobstructed action
To function in harmony, side by side
To engage in economic cooperation.
Permission; granting, conceding, or admitting
Acknowledgment.
That which is allowed; a share or portion allotted or granted; a sum granted as a reimbursement, a bounty, or as appropriate for any purpose; a stated quantity.
definitions.example: her meagre allowance of food or drink

definitions.definition: Abatement; deduction; the taking into account of mitigating circumstances
definitions.example: to make allowance for his naivety

definitions.definition: A customary deduction from the gross weight of goods, differing by country.
definitions.example: Tare and tret are examples of allowance.

definitions.definition: A permitted reduction in the weight that a racehorse must carry.
definitions.example: On the Flat, an apprentice jockey starts with an allowance of 7 lb.

definitions.definition: A child's allowance; pocket money.
definitions.example: She gives her daughters each an allowance of thirty dollars a month.

definitions.definition: (minting) A permissible deviation in the fineness and weight of coins, owing to the difficulty in securing exact conformity to the standard prescribed by law.
Approval; approbation
License; indulgence
To put upon a fixed allowance (especially of provisions and drink).
definitions.example: The captain was obliged to allowance his crew.

definitions.definition: To supply in a fixed and limited quantity.
definitions.example: Our provisions were allowanced.

definitions.definition: To examine critically or carefully; especially, to search out problems or determine condition; to scrutinize.
definitions.example: Inspect the system for leaks.

definitions.definition: To view and examine officially.
definitions.example: The general inspected the troops and their barracks.

definitions.definition: An aristocrat; one of aristocratic blood.
definitions.example: This country house was occupied by nobles in the 16th century.

definitions.definition: A medieval gold coin of England in the 14th and 15th centuries, usually valued at 6s 8d.
Having honorable qualities; having moral eminence and freedom from anything petty, mean or dubious in conduct and character.
definitions.example: He is a noble man who would never put his family in jeopardy.

definitions.definition: Grand; stately; magnificent; splendid.
definitions.example: a noble edifice

definitions.definition: Of exalted rank; of or relating to the nobility; distinguished from the masses by birth, station, or title; highborn.
definitions.example: noble blood; a noble personage

definitions.definition: (of a polyhedron) Both isohedral and isogonal.
One who practices or advocates socialism.
Of, promoting, practicing, or characteristic of socialism.
A decorated cloth hung at the back of a stage.
An image that serves as a visual background.
The setting or background of an acted performance.
Any background situation.
definitions.example: Against a backdrop of falling interest rates, the new savings account is looking less appealing.

definitions.definition: To serve as a backdrop for.
definitions.example: a brilliant sunset backdropping the famous skyline

definitions.definition: To gain (an object or desired result).
definitions.example: To attain such a high level of proficiency requires hours of practice each day.

definitions.definition: To reach or come to, by progression or motion; to arrive at (a place, time, state, etc.).
To come or arrive, by motion, growth, bodily exertion, or efforts toward a place, object, state, etc.
To get at the knowledge of.
To reach in excellence or degree.
To reach a person after being behind them.

An agreement between parties concerning the sale of property; or a contract by which one party binds himself to transfer the right to some property for a consideration, and the other party binds himself to receive the property and pay the consideration.
An agreement or stipulation; mutual pledge.
An item purchased for significantly less than the usual, or recommended, price
A gainful transaction; an advantageous purchase.
definitions.example: At that price, it's not just a bargain, it's a steal.

definitions.definition: The thing stipulated or purchased.
To make a bargain; to make a deal or contract for the exchange of property or services; to negotiate
definitions.example: They had to bargain for a few minutes to get a decent price for the rug.

definitions.definition: To transfer for a consideration; to barter; to trade
A person who shares a parent; one's brother or sister who one shares a parent with.
definitions.example: None of my siblings are married yet.

definitions.definition: A node in a data structure that shares its parent with another node.
The most closely related species, or one of several most closely species when none can be determined to be more closely related.
To provoke someone to do wrong, especially by promising a reward; to entice.
definitions.example: She tempted me to eat the apple.

definitions.definition: To attract; to allure.
definitions.example: Its glossy skin tempted me.

definitions.definition: To provoke something; to court.
definitions.example: It would be tempting fate.

definitions.definition: The act of moving in a circle, or in a course which brings the moving body to the place where its motion began.
The act of passing from place to place or person to person; free diffusion; transmission.
Currency; circulating coins; notes, bills, etc., current for coin.
definitions.example: The new bills will come into circulation next Friday.

definitions.definition: The extent to which anything circulates or is circulated; the measurement of diffusion
The movement of the blood in the circulatory system, by which it is brought into close relations with almost every living elementary constituent.
The movement of the sap in the vessels and tissues of plants.
A foster parent.
definitions.example: Some fosters end up adopting.

definitions.definition: The care given to another; guardianship.
To nurture or bring up offspring, or to provide similar parental care to an unrelated child.
To cultivate and grow something.
definitions.example: Our company fosters an appreciation for the arts.

definitions.definition: To nurse or cherish something.
To be nurtured or trained up together.
Providing parental care to children not related to oneself.
definitions.example: foster parents

definitions.definition: Receiving such care.
definitions.example: a foster child

definitions.definition: Related by such care.
definitions.example: We are a foster family.

definitions.definition: A forester.
A gap or opening made by breaking or battering, as in a wall, fortification or levee / embankment; the space between the parts of a solid body rent by violence
A breaking up of amicable relations, a falling-out.
A breaking of waters, as over a vessel or a coastal defence; the waters themselves
definitions.example: A clear breach is when the waves roll over the vessel without breaking. A clean breach is when everything on deck is swept away.

definitions.definition: A breaking out upon; an assault.
A bruise; a wound.
A hernia; a rupture.
A breaking or infraction of a law, or of any obligation or tie; violation; non-fulfillment
A difference in opinions, social class etc.
The act of breaking, in a figurative sense.
To make a breach in.
definitions.example: They breached the outer wall, but not the main one.

definitions.definition: To violate or break.
(of the sea) To break into a ship or into a coastal defence.
(of a whale) To leap out of the water.
A change of position.
An unfolding.
Process of development.
The act or process of complicating.
The state of being complicated; intricate or confused relation of parts; complexity.
A person who doesn't fit in with the main scheme of things; an interloper.
A disease or diseases, or adventitious circumstances or conditions, coexistent with and modifying a primary disease, but not necessarily connected with it.
A feature beyond basic time display in a timepiece.
Something or someone of any value; any portion of one's property or effects so considered.
definitions.example: These shares are a valuable asset.

definitions.definition: Any component, model, process or framework of value that can be leveraged or reused.
An intelligence asset.
(usually in the plural) The private parts; a woman's breasts or buttocks, or a man's genitalia.
(chiefly in the plural) A problem or difficulty in a particular field of study.
Posing a problem; having or suffering from problem(s):
Only affirming the possibility that a predicate be actualised.

A special form of secured loan where the purpose of the loan must be specified to the lender, to purchase assets that must be fixed (not movable) property, such as a house or piece of farm land. The assets are registered as the legal property of the borrower but the lender can seize them and dispose of them if they are not satisfied with the manner in which the repayment of the loan is conducted by the borrower. Once the loan is fully repaid, the lender loses this right of seizure and the assets are then deemed to be unencumbered.
definitions.example: We're renting a property in the city centre because we can't afford to get a mortgage yet.

definitions.definition: State of being pledged.
definitions.example: lands given in mortgage

definitions.definition: To borrow against a property, to obtain a loan for another purpose by giving away the right of seizure to the lender over a fixed property such as a house or piece of land; to pledge a property in order to get a loan.
definitions.example: We mortgaged our house in order to start a company.

definitions.definition: To pledge and make liable; to make subject to obligation; to achieve an immediate result by paying for it in the long term.
A group or sect of people with a deviant religious, philosophical or cultural identity, often existing on the margins of society or exploitative towards its members.
definitions.example: Oh my gosh, I'm in a repressive cult! How can I leave it?

definitions.definition: Devotion to a saint.
The veneration and religious rites given to a deity, esp. in a historical polytheistic context.
A religion that evolved out of another religion but has become a different religion through developing a radically different theology.
A group of people having an obsession with or intense admiration for a particular activity, idea, person or thing.
Of or relating to a cult.
Enjoyed by a small, loyal group.
definitions.example: a cult horror movie

definitions.definition: True to the ideology of black metal or a stereotypical manifestation of that subculture.
definitions.example: You gotta wear make-up at kvlt gigs or you'll be thrown out.

definitions.definition: A wide band of electromagnetic frequencies
An internet connection provisioned over an existing service using alternate signal frequencies such as ADSL or cable modem.
Of, pertaining to, or carrying a wide band of electromagnetic frequencies
The right to vote at a public election or referendum; see: suffrage, suffragette.
A right or privilege officially granted to a person, a group of people, or a company by a government.
An acknowledgment of a corporation's existence and ownership.
The authorization granted by a company to sell or distribute its goods or services in a certain area.
definitions.example: McDonalds has exported its franchise.

definitions.definition: A business operating under such authorization, a franchisee.
A legal exemption from jurisdiction.
The membership of a corporation or state; citizenship.
The district or jurisdiction to which a particular privilege extends; the limits of an immunity; hence, an asylum or sanctuary.
The collection of organizations in the history of a sports team; the tradition of a sports team as an entity, extending beyond the contemporary organization.
definitions.example: The Whalers' home city of Hartford was one of many for the franchise.

definitions.definition: The positive influence on the buying behavior of customers exerted by the reputation of a company or a brand.
The loose collection of fictional works pertaining to a particular universe, including literary, film or television series from various sources.
definitions.example: the Star Wars franchise

definitions.definition: Exemption from constraint or oppression; freedom; liberty.
Magnanimity; generosity; liberality; frankness; nobility.
To confer certain powers on; grant a franchise to; authorize.
To set free; invest with a franchise or privilege; enfranchise.
(chiefly in the plural) That which is left; relic; remainder.
(in the plural) That which is left of a human being after the life is gone; relics; a dead body.
Posthumous works or productions, especially literary works.
State of remaining; stay.

To stay behind while others withdraw; to be left after others have been removed or destroyed; to be left after a number or quantity has been subtracted or cut off; to be left as not included or comprised.
To continue unchanged in place, form, or condition, or undiminished in quantity; to abide; to stay; to endure; to last.
definitions.example: There was no food in the house, so I had to remain hungry.

definitions.definition: To await; to be left to.
To continue in a state of being.
definitions.example: The light remained red for two full minutes.

definitions.definition: What is left after a person (or any organism) dies; a corpse.
definitions.example: The victim's remains were one small piece of bone.

definitions.definition: Historical or archaeological relics.
The extant writings of a deceased person.
definitions.example: To his great intellectual powers his published remains bear abundant witness.

definitions.definition: All that is left of the stock of some things; remnants.
definitions.example: He couldn't bring himself to eat the remains of the chicken dinner.

definitions.definition: Any plant of the genus Nicotiana.
Leaves of Nicotiana tabacum and some other species cultivated and harvested to make cigarettes, cigars, snuff, for smoking in pipes or for chewing.
A variety of tobacco.
definitions.example: Tobaccos from the Connecticut Valley were used for wrapping cigars.

definitions.definition: To indulge in tobacco; to smoke.
To treat with tobacco.
The chemical element (symbol O) with an atomic number of 8 and relative atomic mass of 15.9994. It is a colorless and odorless gas.
Molecular oxygen (O2), a colorless, odorless gas at room temperature, also called dioxygen.
A mixture of oxygen and other gases, administered to a patient to help them breathe.
An atom of this element.
Far off (physically, logically or mentally).
definitions.example: We heard a distant rumbling but didn't pay any more attention to it.   She was surprised to find that her fiancé was a distant relative of hers.   His distant look showed that he was not listening to me.

definitions.definition: Emotionally unresponsive or unwilling to express genuine feelings.
definitions.example: Ever since our argument, she has been totally distant toward me.

definitions.definition: Someone who is hoping for success or victory, especially as a candidate in a political election.
definitions.example: Several presidential hopefuls are campaigning in New Hampshire this week.

definitions.definition: Feeling hope
definitions.example: I am hopeful that I will recover from the disease.

definitions.definition: Inspiring hope
An ethnic person, especially a foreigner or member of an immigrant community.
An ethnic minority.
A heathen, a pagan.
(in classical scholarship) the demonym of an Ancient Greek city
Of or relating to a group of people having common racial, ancestral, national, religious or cultural origins.
definitions.example: There are many ethnic Indonesians in the Netherlands

definitions.definition: Characteristic of a foreign, usually non-Western culture.
definitions.example: I like to eat ethnic food

definitions.definition: Representative of a folk or traditional mode of expression.
Heathen, not Jewish, Christian, or Muslim.
To change place or posture; to go, in any manner, from one place or position to another.
definitions.example: A ship moves rapidly.

definitions.definition: To act; to take action; to begin to act
definitions.example: Come on guys, let's move: there's work to do!

definitions.definition: To change residence, for example from one house, town, or state, to another; to go and live at another place. See also move out and move in.
definitions.example: I decided to move to the country for a more peaceful life.

definitions.definition: (and other games) To change the place of a piece in accordance with the rules of the game.
definitions.example: My opponent's counter was moving much quicker round the board than mine.

definitions.definition: To cause to change place or posture in any manner; to set in motion; to carry, convey, draw, or push from one place to another
definitions.example: The horse moves a carriage.

definitions.definition: To transfer (a piece or man) from one space or position to another, according to the rules of the game
definitions.example: She moved the queen closer to the centre of the board.

definitions.definition: To excite to action by the presentation of motives; to rouse by representation, persuasion, or appeal; to influence.
definitions.example: This song moves me to dance.

definitions.definition: To arouse the feelings or passions of; especially, to excite to tenderness or compassion, to excite (for example, an emotion).
definitions.example: That book really moved me.

definitions.definition: To propose; to recommend; specifically, to propose formally for consideration and determination, in a deliberative assembly; to submit
definitions.example: I move to repeal the rule regarding obligatory school uniform.

definitions.definition: To mention; to raise (a question); to suggest (a course of action); to lodge (a complaint).
To incite, urge (someone to do something); to solicit (someone for or of an issue); to make a proposal to.
To apply to, as for aid.
To request an action from the court.
definitions.example: An attorney moved the court to issue a restraining order.

definitions.definition: To bow or salute upon meeting.
To sell, to market (especially, but not exclusively, illegal products)
The relocation of goods
A causing of a movement
definitions.example: The rats' movings are willed movements.

definitions.definition: That moves or move.
definitions.example: moving pictures

definitions.definition: That causes someone to feel emotion.
The area where a land battle is or was fought, which is not necessarily a field.
definitions.example: 1886 The night of the 16th of May found McPherson's command bivouacked from two to six miles west of the battlefield, along the line of the road to Vicksburg — Ulysses S. Grant, Personal memoirs of U.S. Grant, Chapter 35.

definitions.definition: The act of stealing property.
A rod bent into a curved shape, typically with one end free and the other end secured to a rope or other attachment.
A barbed metal hook used for fishing; a fishhook.
Any of various hook-shaped agricultural implements such as a billhook.
The curved needle used in the art of crochet.
The part of a hinge which is fixed to a post, and on which a door or gate hangs and turns.
A loop shaped like a hook under certain written letters, for example, g and j.
A tie-in to a current event or trend that makes a news story or editorial relevant and timely.
A snare; a trap.
(in the plural) The projecting points of the thighbones of cattle; called also hook bones.
Removal or expulsion from a group or activity
definitions.example: He is not handling this job, so we're giving him the hook.

definitions.definition: A field sown two years in succession.
(authorship) A brief, punchy opening statement intended to get attention from an audience, reader, or viewer, and make them want to continue to listen to a speech, read a book, or watch a play.
(authorship) A gimmick or element of a creative work intended to be attention-grabbing for the audience; a compelling idea for a story that will be sure to attract people's attention.
A finesse.
A jack (the playing card).
A spit or narrow cape of sand or gravel turned landward at the outer end, such as Sandy Hook in New Jersey.
A catchy musical phrase which forms the basis of a popular song.
definitions.example: The song's hook snared me.

definitions.definition: A ship's anchor.
Part of a system's operation that can be intercepted to change or augment its behaviour.
definitions.example: We've added hooks to allow undefined message types to be handled with custom code.

definitions.definition: (Scrabble) An instance of playing a word perpendicular to a word already on the board, adding a letter to the start or the end of the word to form a new word.
A diacritical mark shaped like the upper part of a question mark, as in ỏ.
A háček.
Senses relating to sports.
To attach a hook to.
definitions.example: Hook the bag here, and the conveyor will carry it away.

definitions.definition: To catch with a hook (hook a fish).
definitions.example: He hooked a snake accidentally, and was so scared he dropped his rod into the water.

definitions.definition: To work yarn into a fabric using a hook; to crochet.
To insert in a curved way reminiscent of a hook.
definitions.example: He hooked his fingers through his belt loops.

definitions.definition: To ensnare or obligate someone, as if with a hook.
definitions.example: A free trial is a good way to hook customers.

definitions.definition: To steal.
To connect (hook into, hook together).
definitions.example: If you hook your network cable into the jack, you'll be on the network.

definitions.definition: (usually in passive) To make addicted; to captivate.
definitions.example: He had gotten hooked on cigarettes in his youth.

definitions.definition: To play a hook shot.
To succeed in heeling the ball back out of a scrum (used particularly of the team's designated hooker).
To engage in the illegal maneuver of hooking (i.e., using the hockey stick to trip or block another player)
definitions.example: The opposing team's forward hooked me, but the referee didn't see it, so no penalty.

definitions.definition: To swerve a ball; kick a ball so it swerves or bends.
To engage in prostitution.
definitions.example: I had a cheap flat in the bad part of town, and I could watch the working girls hooking from my bedroom window.

definitions.definition: (Scrabble) To play a word perpendicular to another word by adding a single letter to the existing word.
To finesse.
To seize or pierce with the points of the horns, as cattle in attacking enemies; to gore.
To move or go with a sudden turn.
A reddish-brown, malleable, ductile metallic element with high electrical and thermal conductivity, symbol Cu, and atomic number 29.
The reddish-brown colour/color of copper.
Any of various specialized items that are made of copper, where the use of copper is either traditional or vital to the function of the item.
Any of various lycaenid butterflies with copper-coloured upperwings, especially those of the genera Lycaena and Paralucia.
To sheathe or coat with copper.
Made of copper.
Having the reddish-brown colour/color of copper.
(law enforcement) A police officer.
A person given as a pledge or security for the performance of the conditions of a treaty or similar agreement, such as to ensure the status of a vassal.
A person seized in order to compel another party to act (or refrain from acting) in a certain way, because of the threat of harm to the hostage.
Something that constrains one's actions because it is at risk.
One who is compelled by something, especially something that poses a threat; one who is not free to choose their own course of action.
The condition of being held as security or to compel someone else to act or not act in a particular way.
(possibly nonstandard) To give (someone or something) as a hostage to (someone or something else).
(possibly nonstandard) To hold (someone or something) hostage, especially in a way that constrains or controls the person or thing held, or in order to exchange for something else.
A narrow hall or passage with rooms leading off it, as in a building or in a railway carriage.
A restricted tract of land that allows passage between two places.
The covered way lying round the whole compass of the fortifications of a place.
Airspace restricted for the passage of aircraft.
An organisation that engages in the activity of broadcasting.
A person whose job it is to broadcast.
The solid remains of a fire.
definitions.example: Ash from a fireplace can restore minerals to your garden's soil.

definitions.definition: The nonaqueous remains of a material subjected to any complete oxidation process.
Fine particles from a volcano, volcanic ash.
(in the plural) Human (or animal) remains after cremation.
definitions.example: The urn containing his ashes was eventually removed to a closet.

definitions.definition: What remains after a catastrophe.
A gray colour, like that of ash.
To reduce to a residue of ash. See ashing.
To hit the end off of a burning cigar or cigarette.
To hit the end off (a burning cigar or cigarette).
(mostly used in the passive) To cover newly-sown fields of crops with ashes.
A shade tree of the genus Fraxinus.
definitions.example: The ash trees are dying off due to emerald ash borer.

definitions.definition: The wood of this tree.
The traditional name for the ae ligature (æ), as used in Old English.
In a continual manner; non-stop.
In regular or repeated succession; very often.
A protective head covering, usually part of armour.
That which resembles a helmet in form, position, etc.
To cover with, or as if with, a helmet.
The condition of being worthy; honour, distinction.
The devotion accorded to a deity or to a sacred object.
The religious ceremonies that express this devotion.
(by extension) Voluntary, utter submission; voluntary, utter deference.
(also by extension) Ardent love.
An object of worship.
Honour; respect; civil deference.
(chiefly British) Used as a title or term of address for various officials, including magistrates
To reverence (a deity, etc.) with supreme respect and veneration; to perform religious exercises in honour of.
To honour with extravagant love and extreme submission, as a lover; to adore; to idolize.
To participate in religious ceremonies.
definitions.example: We worship at the church down the road.

definitions.definition: One who watches an event; especially, one held outdoors.
definitions.example: The cheering spectators watched the fireworks.

definitions.definition: The process of collecting money by requesting donations from individuals and businesses.
The dividing line or location between two areas.
(often in the plural) The bounds, confines, or limits between immaterial things (such as one’s comfort zone, privacy, or professional sphere and the realm beyond).
An edge or line marking an edge of the playing field.

An event whereby the ball is struck and either touches or passes over a boundary (with or without bouncing), usually resulting in an award of 4 (four) or 6 (six) runs respectively for the batting team.
(of a set) The set of points in the closure of a set S, not belonging to the interior of that set.
Pertaining to democracy; favoring democracy, or constructed upon the principle of government by the people.
definitions.example: The United States is a democratic country, as the citizens are allowed to choose leaders to represent their interests.

definitions.definition: Relating to a political party so called; usually, Democratic.
definitions.example: Mount Vernon is run by a strong democratic party organization.

definitions.definition: Exhibiting social equality, egalitarian (see online Oxford).
A biological product.
Of or relating to biology.
Related by consanguinity, especially as to parents and children.
(an error in NNES) Organic (grown without agrochemicals).
